article.title: SAIC Awarded $38 Million Contract by Hawaii Public Utilities Commission to Support Energy Efficiency
article.author: Katie Packard
article.text: Science Applications International Corporation (SAIC) has been awarded a prime contract by the Hawaii Public Utilities Commission to become the program administrator for the Hawaii Energy Efficiency Program, which helps Hawaii residents and businesses become more energy efficient. The contract has a value for the first two years of $38 million.
